summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between attorneys from the law firm WilmerHale (representing JPMorgan) and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and calls to discuss identifying a trial witness from JPMorgan and providing a subpoena.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing JPMorgan, coordinating with the prosecution to schedule meetings and discuss providing a trial witness and subpoena.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York handling the Ghislaine Maxwell case, corresponding with defense attorneys about trial witness issues and scheduling.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale copied on the email correspondence regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case and JPMorgan witness matters.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.role: Individual to be included in meeting
persons.context: Referred to as 'Pat', this person is the subject of scheduling for a call/meeting between the legal teams.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Named as a recipient in one email regarding the discussion about identifying a JPMorgan trial witness.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Named as a recipient in one email regarding the discussion about identifying a JPMorgan trial witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced throughout the email subject lines (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).

connections.description: Attorney for JPMorgan (WilmerHale) corresponding with the prosecuting AUSA about trial logistics and witness issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Both are attorneys at WilmerHale working on the JPMorgan matter related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Stoddart is scheduling a call/meeting that includes Pat McHugh, indicating a professional association.
Alison is the prosecuting AUSA in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Mentioned as occurring during the week of November 15, 2021, making scheduling difficult for the legal teams.

events.title: Request for Trial Subpoena to JPMorgan
events.description: Allison Stoddart requests the prosecution provide a trial appearance subpoena for a JPMorgan witness.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Pat
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for Monday, November 22, 2021, at 6pm between the legal teams and Pat McHugh, to be held via Zoom.

locations: 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The correspondence reveals coordination between JPMorgan's attorneys (WilmerHale) and the prosecution to secure a trial witness from JPMorgan for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The prosecution is asked to provide a 'broadly worded subpoena' to JPMorgan to facilitate the appearance of a witness at trial.
Scheduling is complicated by ongoing jury selection in the Maxwell trial during November 2021, leading to proposed evening and weekend meetings.
The emails show the use of external email warnings ('EXTERNAL SENDER'), indicating communication between government and private counsel.
A specific individual, Pat McHugh, is a focal point for a scheduled meeting between the legal teams.
